Package com.andreasmenzel.adds_dji.Manager

Class TrafficControlManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.andreasmenzel.adds_dji.Manager.TrafficControlManager
  • public class TrafficControlManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The Traffic Control Manager. This provides a high-level interface to send data to and request data from the Traffic Control. This manager handles connection failures, tries resending failed requests and automatically sends data that the Traffic Control requests.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TrafficControlManager()
      Initializes the Traffic Control Manager: Registers to the event bus, gets the djiManager and starts checking the connection to the Traffic Control.

      Executes the stopAutoCommunicationTell() method.
      private void processTellsToSend()
      Executes the sendTell() method for all TELLs currently in the buffer list.

      Increments the totalRequestsFailed counter and creates the NowDisconnected() event if multiple requests previously failed.

    • Method Detail

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Unregisters from the event bus.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if a Throwable was thrown.

      • checkConnection

        public void checkConnection()
        Checks the connection to the Traffic Control by sending a how_are_you and checking for the version field in the (JSON) response.

      • sendAsynchronousRequest

        private void sendAsynchronousRequest​(java.lang.String requestGroup,
                                     java.lang.String requestType,
                                     java.lang.String requestData)
        Sends an asynchronous request to the Traffic Control.
        Parameters:
        requestGroup - The request group, e.g. "tell" or "ask".
        requestType - The request type, e.g. "here_i_am" in request group "tell".
        requestData - The request data, e.g. "drone_id=demo_drone&i_say=hello"

      • nowConnected

        @Subscribe
public void nowConnected​(NowConnected event)
        Executes the startAutoCommunicationTell() method. This method is executed whenever a connection to the Traffic Control could be established.

      • nowDisconnected

        @Subscribe
public void nowDisconnected​(NowDisconnected event)
        Executes the stopAutoCommunicationTell() method. This method is executed whenever the connection to the Traffic Control was lost.

      • notConnected

        @Subscribe
public void notConnected​(NotConnected event)
        Periodically checks the connection to the Traffic Control. This method is executed whenever the NotConnected event was sent.

      • requestFailed

        @Subscribe
public void requestFailed​(RequestFailed event)
        Increments the totalRequestsFailed counter and creates the NowDisconnected() event if multiple requests previously failed. This method is called whenever the RequestFailed event was sent.

      • requestSucceeded

        @Subscribe
public void requestSucceeded​(RequestSucceeded event)
        Increments the totalRequestsSucceeded counter and resets the requestsFailed counter. This method is executed whenever the RequestSucceeded event was sent.

      • startAutoCommunicationTell

        public void startAutoCommunicationTell()
        Starts the automatic communication for all TELLs. This will send periodic TELL updates to the Traffic System.

      • stopAutoCommunicationTell

        public void stopAutoCommunicationTell()
        Stops the automatic communication for TELLs.

      • addTellToSend

        private void addTellToSend​(java.lang.String tell)
        Adds a new TELL to the buffer list.

      • processTellsToSend

        private void processTellsToSend()
        Executes the sendTell() method for all TELLs currently in the buffer list.

      • sendTell

        private void sendTell​(@NonNull
                      java.lang.String tell)
        Gathers the necessary information and sends the TELL request.

public void gotTellResponse​(@NonNull
                            GotTellResponse event)
        Handles the response from a TELL request.

      • tellFailed

        @Subscribe
public void tellFailed​(TellFailed event)
        Handles a failed TELL request.

        The total number of requests succeeded.
